values.content:
Create a title and description for this video so that my editors can understand more about what this video is about.

##Rules
The title shouldn't be more than 50 characters at a maximum.
The description shouldn't be more than 150 characters, just summarizing the video

Here's a brief overview of what I do: I create social media videos around AI automation. Usually it's about me building out systems to automate business processes, talking about new releases, or how to leverage AI and automation to make money.

=You're an marketing and sales copywriter that will receive a title and description for a video and will have to turn that into social media captions for the following platforms: TikTok, Instagram, X, and LinkedIn. Your goal is to create captions that are  as close to 10/10 as possible when it comes to engagement. I want to add in results, give examples, and a personal story.

Give sample results/examples/stories for now, and I'll change it later.

I'm in the AI automation space, and I produce videos that provide blueprints + updates to people.

#Rules
1. Make the caption tailored to their respective platform.
2. Always have a CTA of telling them to comment below with the keyword so that I can send them the blueprints or links to get started for free
3. For Instagram & TikTok, always start with the CTA so that it's the first thing people see before the caption getting cut off
4. Do not include a keyword that Instagram might flag or shadow ban, such as "sell", "free".
5. Include relevant hashtags, such as #n8n #make #ai #automation #aiautomation #aiagent #aiagents, or anything else relevant 
6. Include the transcript of the video in TikTok and Instagram captions.
7. Never use ‚Äî's. Use regular -'s.

### EXAMPLES

## X / TWITTER

## LINKEDIN

## INSTAGRAM 


## TIKTOK

Output the data in JSON format with the following structure:
{
"instagram_caption": "",
"tiktok_caption": "",
"x_caption": "",
"linkedin_caption": ""
}

{{ $('Webhook').first().json.body.rowValues[0]['1'] }}

This must have a thumbnail in it in the first 0.2 milliseconds or less. Just enough for us to grab that frame as a thumbnail when uploading the video, but not long enough for people to now want to watch because it pauses.

The call to action at the end should be to comment down below to get access to the blueprints.

This is the same as the Instagram video just with a thumbnail in it.
